definition: to wish for/to desire/variant of 慾|欲[yu4]

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: The LORD will not suffer the soul of the righteous to famish : but he casteth away the substance of the wicked.
sentences.chinese: 耶和华不容许义人抵受饥饿，恶人的欲念却无法得着。

sentences.english: You are my fire, you are my desire.
sentences.chinese: 你是我的生命之火，我的欲念之光。

sentences.english: My constant state of relaxation would prevent any desire to complicate my life.
sentences.chinese: 放松的状态可以防止任何使我生活复杂的欲念。

sentences.english: Lust means - I must have it at once.
sentences.chinese: 欲念的意思是“我必须现在就得到它。”

sentences.english: Is almost choked by unresisted lust.
sentences.chinese: 审慎的顾虑几乎被猖狂的欲念窒息。

definition: to wriggle/(fig.) to stir up trouble/(of a sentiment) to stir
